. It spreads from the southern tail of the Ural Mountains, across the Caspian lowlands, to the shores of the Caspian Sea. This 436,000 km² area is Kazakhstan's oft-overlooked slice of easternmost Europe and is bigger than Sweden. The country's major port cities are and some Soviet-style beach resorts line the sea shore. The region comprises the provinces of Atyrau, Mangystau, and West Kazakhstan. If you are find yourself outside of the three provincial capitals,
, respectively, you are either an oil man, or you're exploring uncharted territory!

The sort of place where you can find only the intangible... and oil
